content: three seasons in scotland a fair isle hot water bottle cover by hanna weibye & jon sanders 1 to fit a standard hot water bottle measuring 8½ x 10inches excluding neck gauge 28sts and 28 rounds to 4 /10cm in fair isle pattern notions 2 5mm and 3 25mm 16 circular needles 3mm dpns 2 stitch markers darning needle 1 neck using 3mm dpns co 92 sts using twisted german tubular or another stretchy cast­on join to work in the round pm to mark beginning of round work in k2 p2 rib for at least 2¾ inches or to desired length make it longer to cover the opening more 2 set up for increasing switch to a 2 5mm 16 circular needle pm k46 pm k46 3 shoulder increases round 1 sm rl increase k to next marker ll increase sm rl increase k to last marker ll increase round 2 k repeat these two rounds 6 more times 120 sts 4 body switch to a 3 25mm 16 circular needle joining in and breaking off yarn as appropriate work from the fair isle body chart for 59 row start bottom right with row 1 and work each row right to left remember to hold the background red yarn in your right hand and the foreground white/oatmeal/yellow/green yarn in your left hand 5 bottom decreases switch to 2 5mm 16 circular needle round 1 k if you discarded the second marker during the fair isle section remember to replace it in this round thus k60 pm k60 round 2 sm ssk k to 2 sts before next marker k2tog sm ssk k to 2 sts before last marker k2tog repeat these two rounds 6 more times 92 sts 6 binding off slip first 46 sts onto a spare circular needle turn work inside out and bind off from the inside using three needle bind off nb you may find it easier to break off the yarn and start the bind­off from the other end rejoining the yarn there darn in ends block to 8½ x 10in or on your hot water bottle abbreviations k knit p purl k2 decrease knit 2 together ll increase left­leaning increase lift left leg of st 2 row below st just worked onto left hand needle and knit rl increase right­leaning increase lift right leg of st 1 row below next st onto left hand needle and knit pm place marker sm slip marker ssk slip slip knit 2 yarn this is a good project for using up odds and ends of yarn it takes less than 2 balls of mc and 15 yards or less of all the other colours the sample was knit in a mix of jamieson s shetland spindrift and jamieson & smith 2­ply jumper weight and shetland supreme jumper weight but you could use any shetland­style 2­ply or a pure wool wollen­spun 4­ply such as those blacker yarns make from different british sheep breeds sample colours amounts used in brackets
